message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.NE, cs.BIO. 

The paper proposes a framework for heart rate monitoring using wrist-type photoplethysmographic signals during intensive physical exercise. The framework involves signal decomposition, sparse signal reconstruction, and spectral peak tracking with verification. This involves machine learning techniques and computer vision techniques, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of cs.LG and cs.CV. The paper also discusses the potential applications of the framework in wearable devices, which falls under the sub-category of cs.HC. Additionally, the paper involves the use of physiological signals, which is relevant to the sub-categories of cs.NE and cs.BIO.
